definition:
The *integer part* of a real number is the part of the number that
appears before the decimal . For example, the integer part of $\pi$ is
$3$, and the integer part of $-\sqrt{2}$ is $-1$.

To be more precise, for $x \in \mathbb{R}$, the integer part of $x$,
denoted as $[x]$, is given by

$$[x]=\begin{cases}
\lfloor x \rfloor \text{ if } x \ge 0 \\
\lceil x \rceil \text{ if } x<0, \end{cases}$$

where $\lfloor x \rfloor$ and $\lceil x \rceil$ denote the floor and
ceiling of $x$, respectively.
